p: The texture orientation θ is defined as the angle between the longitudinal direction of texture and y axis, as shown in Figure 9. The tip slides along x direction. In order to study the effects of texture orientation on friction behaviors, five different orientations ( θ = 0°, 30°, 45°, 60° and 90°) are used. For all the textures, the width is w = 0.723 nm, the spacing is g = 1.0845 nm, and the depth is d = 0.723 nm.
